creator: daniel.fleischer@active-endpoints.com
text:
I'm using the WebServices(SOAP) Request and a Graph Results listener a simple 
Test Plan I'm using to become familiar with JMeter.  I'll run 10 Threads, with 
a 3 second delay and have it Loop for a count of 100.  

I'll start running the test and the "Throughput" value displayed on the bottom 
of the Graph Results page will show a value such as "515.185/minute".  The 
green line shown in the Graph itself will be displayed in a position 
representing this value, this is correct behavior.  However, sometimes when 
running the Test Plan, when the "Number of Samples" reaches 700+ 
the "Throughput" value will be displayed with a value such as "4.322764E-
5/minute".  When this happens the green line shown in the Graph drops all the 
way to the bottom.  After this happens, "sometimes" when I try to run another 
test the green Graph line will stay at the bottom of the graph, even though 
the "Throughput" value is a value such as "515.185/minute".  I see no errors 
in the console or in the log file, nor are there any errors in the application 
under test.

creator: daniel.fleischer@active-endpoints.com
text:
The problem was caused by bugs within the WebServices(SOAP) Request feature.  
A developer at my company has resolved the errors and submitted his fixes 
through the normal procedure you folks have in-place.

I was mistaken with my previous post that the bug was fixed. The throughput 
bug still exists and would show up in other circumstances when there's an 
error generating a sample.
creator: daniel.fleischer@active-endpoints.com
